LabelSelectorRequirementOperator.description:
- In: In means the value for 'key' should be in one of the given value(s)
 - NotIn: NotIn means the value for 'key' should NOT be in one of the given value(s)
 - Exists: Exists means the 'key' should just exist regardless of the value
 - DoesNotExist: DoesNotExist means the 'key' should NOT exist
 - Gt: Gt means the 'key' should be greater than the value(s)
 - Lt: Lt means the 'key' should be less than the value(s)
LabelSelectorRequirementOperator.title: This defines operator types used in a label matching rule

SdkServiceCapabilityOpenStorageServiceTy.title:

 - VOLUME: Volume management

VolumePlacementRuleAffinityRuleType.description:
- Affinity: Affinity means the rule specifies an affinity to objects that match the below label selector requirements
 - AntiAffinity: AntiAffinity means the rule specifies an anti-affinity to objects that match the below label selector requirements
VolumePlacementRuleAffinityRuleType.title: This specifies the type an affinity rule can take

VolumePlacementRuleEnforcementType.description:
- Required: This specifies that the rule is required and must be strictly enforced
 - Preferred: This specifies that the rule is preferred and can be best effort
VolumePlacementRuleEnforcementType.title: Defines the types of enforcement on the given rules

early_ack.description: EarlyAck enables acks for async I/O at the source.

apiLabelSelectorRequirement.description:
LabelSelectorRequirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

key.description: Key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description:
Operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.
Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description:
Values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.

action.title: Action being taken on this objectstore

current_endpoint.title: CurrentEndpoint on which objectstore server is accessible

volume_id.title: VolumeID of volume used by object store

apiObjectstoreInfo.title:
ObjectstoreInfo is a structure that has current objectstore info

apiReplicaSet.title:
ReplicaSet set of machine IDs (nodes) to which part of this volume is erasure
coded - for clustered storage arrays
swagger:model

apiRuntimeStateMap.title:
RuntimeStateMap is a list of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

Each query object is one of the three query types and a list of
options.

opts.description: Opts is a list of options associated with one of the queries.

SdkAlertsResourceIdQuery queries for alerts using resource id

no_delay_before_deleting_mount_path.description:
Do not wait for a delay before deleting path.
Normally a storage driver may delay before deleting the mount path,
which may be necessary to reduce the risk of race conditions. This
choice will remove that delay. This value is only usable when
`delete_mount_path` is set.

locator.description:
Change locator values. Some of these values may not be able to be changed.
New labels will be added to the current volume labels. To delete a label, set the
value of the label to an empty string.

spec.description:
VolumeSpecUpdate provides a method to request that certain values
in the VolumeSpec are changed. This is necessary as a separate variable
because values like int and bool in the VolumeSpec cannot be determined
if they are being requested to change in gRPC proto3. Some of these
values may not be able to be changed.
Here are a few examples of actions that can be accomplished using the VolumeSpec.
To resize the volume: Set a new value in spec.size.
To change number of replicas: Adjust spec.ha_level.
To change the I/O Profile: Adjust spec.io_profile.

volume_id.title: Id of the volume to update

apiSdkVolumeUpdateRequest.title: This request is used to adjust or set new values in the volume

parent.description: A volume id, if specified will create a clone of the parent.

seed.title:
Seed will seed the volume from the specified URI
Any additional config for the source comes from the labels in the spec

apiSource.title:
Source is a structure that can be given to a volume
to seed the volume with data.

read_ms.title: Time spent in reads in ms

write_ms.title: Time spent in writes in ms

secure_device_path.description: SecureDevicePath is the device path for an encrypted volume.

source.description: Source specified seed data for the volume.

state.description: State is the current runtime state of this volume.

status.description: Status is the availability status of this volume.

usage.description: Usage is bytes consumed by vtheis volume.

volume_consumers.title: VolumeConsumers are entities that consume this volume

apiVolume.title:
Volume represents an abstract storage volume.
swagger:model

name.title: Name is the name of the volume consumer

namespace.title: Namespace is the namespace of the volume consumer

node_id.description:
NodeID is the identifier of the node on which the consumer is running. This
identifier would be from the perspective of the container runtime or
orchestrator under which the volume consumer resides. For example, NodeID
 can be name of a minion in Kubernetes.

owner_name.title: OwnerName is the name of the entity who owns this volume consumer

owner_type.description:
OwnerType is the type of the entity who owns this volume consumer. The type would
be from the perspective of the container runtime or the orchestrator under which
the volume consumer resides. For e.g OwnerType can be a Deployment in Kubernetes.

type.title: Type is the type of the consumer. E.g a Kubernetes pod

apiVolumeConsumer.title:
VolumeConsumer identifies a consumer for a Volume. An example of a VolumeConsumer
would be a Pod in Kubernetes who has mounted the PersistentVolumeClaim for the
Volume
swagger: model

volume_labels.title: A set of name-value pairs that acts as search filters

apiVolumeLocator.title:
VolumeLocator is a structure that is attached to a volume
and is used to carry opaque metadata.
swagger:model

affected_replicas.title:
AffectedReplicas defines the number of volume replicas affected by this rule. If not provided,
rule would affect all replicas
(optional)

enforcement.title:
Enforcement specifies the rule enforcement policy. Can take values: required or preferred.
(optional)

match_expressions.description: MatchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

type.title: Type is the type of the affinity rule

weight.title:
Weight defines the weight of the rule which allows to break the tie with other matching rules. A rule with
higher weight wins over a rule with lower weight.
(optional)

apiVolumePlacementRule.title: VolumePlacementRule defines a single placement rule

rules.description:
Rules defines a list of rules as part of the placement spec. All the rules specified will
be applied for volume placement.
Rules that have enforcement as "required" are strictly enforced while "preferred" are best effort.
In situations, where 2 or more rules conflict, the weight of the rules will dictate which wins.

apiVolumePlacementStrategy.title: VolumePlacementStrategy defines a strategy for placing volumes in the cluster which will be a series of rules

aggregation_level.description: Aggregatiokn level Specifies the number of parts the volume can be aggregated from.

cascaded.description: Cascaded is true if this volume can be populated on any node from an external source.

compressed.description: Compressed is true if this volume is to be compressed.

cos.description: Cos specifies the relative class of service.

dedupe.description: Dedupe specifies if the volume data is to be de-duplicated.

encrypted.description: Encrypted is true if this volume will be cryptographically secured.

force_unsupported_fs_type.description:
Use to force a file system type which is not recommended.
The driver may still refuse to use the file system type.

format.description: Format specifies the filesystem for this volume.

group_enforced.description: GroupEnforced is true if consistency group creation is enforced.

ha_level.description: HaLevel specifies the number of copies of data.

io_profile.description: IoProfile provides a hint about application using this volume.

journal.description: Journal is true if data for the volume goes into the journal.

nodiscard.description:
Nodiscard specifies if the volume will be mounted with discard support disabled.
i.e. FS will not release allocated blocks back to the backing storage pool.

placement_strategy.description: PlacementStrategy specifies a spec to indicate where to place the volume.

queue_depth.title: QueueDepth defines the desired block device queue depth

replica_set.description: ReplicaSet is the desired set of nodes for the volume data.

shared.description: Shared is true if this volume can be concurrently accessed by multiple users.

sharedv4.description: Sharedv4 is true if this volume can be accessed via sharedv4.

size.title: Size specifies the thin provisioned volume size in bytes

snapshot_interval.title: SnapshotInterval in minutes, set to 0 to disable snapshots

snapshot_schedule.description: SnapshotSchedule a well known string that specifies when snapshots should be taken.

sticky.description: Sticky volumes cannot be deleted until the flag is removed.

apiVolumeSpec.title:
VolumeSpec has the properties needed to create a volume.
swagger:model

replica_set.description: ReplicaSet is the desired set of nodes for the volume data.

apiVolumeSpecUpdate.title: VolumeSpecUpdate provides a method to set any of the VolumeSpec of an existing volume

apiVolumeState.description:
VolumeState represents the state of a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATE_PENDING: Volume is transitioning to new state
 - VOLUME_STATE_AVAILABLE: Volume is ready to be assigned to a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_ATTACHED: Volume is attached to container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETACHED: Volume is detached but associated with a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETATCHING: Volume detach is in progress
 - VOLUME_STATE_ERROR: Volume is in error state
 - VOLUME_STATE_DELETED: Volume is deleted, it will remain in this state
while resources are asynchronously reclaimed
 - VOLUME_STATE_TRY_DETACHING: Volume is trying to be detached
 - VOLUME_STATE_RESTORE: Volume is undergoing restore

apiVolumeStatus.description:
VolumeStatus represents a health status for a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATUS_NOT_PRESENT: Volume is not present
 - VOLUME_STATUS_UP: Volume is healthy
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DOWN: Volume is in fail mode
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DEGRADED: Volume is up but with degraded performance
In a RAID group, this may indicate a problem with one or more drives

openstorageapiStatus.title: - STATUS_MAX: Add statuses before MAX and update the number for MAX

delete.description:
#### Delete
Delete allows 3 different types of queries as defined below:

* Query that takes only resource type as input
* Query that takes resource type and alert type as input and
* Query that takes resource id, alert type and resource type as input.

#### Input
SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest takes a list of such queries and all alerts
that match at least one of the queries are deleted.

get.description:
#### Enumerate
Enumerate allows 3 different types of queries as defined below:

* Query that takes only resource type as input
* Query that takes resource type and alert type as input and
* Query that takes resource id, alert type and resource type as input.

#### Input
SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest takes a list of such queries and the returned
output is a collective ouput from each of these queries. In that sense,
the filtering of these queries has a behavior of OR operation.
Each query also has a list of optional options. These options allow
narrowing down the scope of alerts search. These options have a
behavior of an AND operation.

#### Examples
To search by a resource type in a given time window would require
initializing SdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery query and pass in
SdkAlertsTimeSpan option into SdkAlertsQuery struct and finally
packing any other such queries into SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest object.
Alternatively, to search by both resource type and alert type, use
SdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery as query builder.
Finally to search all alerts of a given resource type and some
alerts of another resource type but with specific alert type,
use two queries, first initialized with SdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery
and second initialized with SdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery and both
eventually packed as list in SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest.
get.summary: Enumerate allows querying alerts.

post.summary:
Creates a backup request for a specified volume. Use
OpenStorageCloudBackup.Status() to get the current status of the
backup request.

parameters.description: Credential id describe the credentials for the cloud.
parameters.name: credential_id

get.summary: Catalog returns a list of the contents in the backup

parameters.description: Credential id is the credential for cloud to be used for the request.
parameters.name: credential_id

parameters.description:
Force Delete cloudbackup even if there are dependencies. This may be
needed if the backup is an incremental backup and subsequent backups
depend on this backup specified by `backup_id`.
parameters.name: force

delete.summary:
Deletes a backup stored in the cloud. If the backup is an incremental
backup and other backups are dependent on it, it will not be able to be deleted.

post.summary: DeleteAll deletes all the backups in the cloud for the specified volume.

Restore creates a new volume from a backup id. The newly created volume
has an ha_level (number of replicas) of only 1. To increase the number of
replicas, use OpenStorageVolume.Set() to change the ha_level.

get.summary: Enumerate cloud backup schedules

post.summary: StateChange can be used to stop, pause, and restart a backup

parameters.description: (optional) Source id of the volume for the request.
parameters.name: src_volume_id

parameters.description: (optional) Cluster id specifies the cluster for the request.
parameters.name: cluster_id

parameters.description: Credential id is the credential for cloud to be used for the request.
parameters.name: credential_id

parameters.description: (optional) All indicates if the request should show cloud backups for all clusters or the current cluster.
parameters.name: all

get.summary: Return a list of backups for the specified volume

parameters.description:
This optional value defines which history of backups is being
requested. If not provided, it will return the history for all volumes.
parameters.name: src_volume_id

get.summary: History returns a list of backups for a specified volume

parameters.description:
VolumeId is an optional value which is used to get information on the
status of a backup for the specified volume. If no volume id and name
is provided, then status for all volumes is returned.
parameters.name: volume_id

parameters.description:
Local indicates if only those backups/restores that are
active on current node must be returned.
parameters.name: local

parameters.description:
Name of the backup/restore task, if this is specified,
volume_id is ignored.
parameters.name: name

get.summary: Status returns the status of any cloud backups of a volume
InspectCurrent returns information about the current cluster
Enumerate returns a list of credential ids

post.summary:
Create is used to submit cloud credentials. It will return an
id of the credentials once they are verified to work.

get.summary: Inspect returns the information about a credential, but does not return the secret key.
Validate is used to validate credentials

Capabilities returns the supported services by the cluster.
This allows SDK implementations to advertise their supported
services as the API matures. With this information, clients
can determine supported services from storage clusters at
different versions.
Version returns version information about the system.

post.summary: Attach attaches device to the host that the client is communicating with.
Detaches a the volume from the host
Mount mounts an attached volume in the host that the client is communicating with
Unmount unmounts a mounted volume in the host that the client is communicating with

get.summary: Enumerate returns the ids of all the nodes in the current cluster

InspectCurrent returns information about the storage node
where the client is currently connected to.
Inspect returns information about the specified node

post.summary: Creates creates an object store endpoint on specified volume

delete.summary: Delete destroys the object store endpoint on the volume

get.summary: Inspect returns information about the object store endpoint

put.summary:
Updates provided objectstore status.
This call can be used to stop and start the server while maintaining the same
object storage id.

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of schedules

post.summary:
Create creates a new snapshot schedule. They can be setup daily,
weekly, or monthly.

get.summary: Inspect returns information about a specified schedule
Enumerate returns a list of volume ids

post.summary: Create creates a volume according to the specification provided
Clone creates a new writable volume cloned from an existing volume
Enumerate returns a list of volume ids that match the labels if any are provided.

Sets the snapshot schedules. This information is saved in the VolumeSpec.snapshot_schedule
as `policy=<name>,...`. This function will overwrite any policy values
in the volume. To delete the policies in the volume send no policies.

SnapshotCreate creates a snapshot of a volume. This creates an immutable (read-only),
point-in-time snapshot of a volume. To create a new writable volume from
a snapshot, please use OpenStorageVolume.Clone().
SnapshotRestore restores a volume to a specified snapshot

get.summary: SnapshotEnumerate returns a list of snapshots for a specific volume

post.summary:
SnapshotEnumerate returns a list of snapshots.
To filter all the snapshots for a specific volume which may no longer exist,
specifiy a volume id.
Labels can also be used to filter the snapshot list.
If neither are provided all snapshots will be returned.

parameters.description:
When set to false the stats are in /proc/diskstats style stats.
When set to true the stats are stats for a specific duration.
parameters.name: not_cumulative

get.summary: Stats returns the statistics for the requested volume
Inspect returns information about a volume

put.summary:
Update provides a method for manipulating the specification and attributes of a volume.
Set can be used to resize a volume, update labels, change replica count, and much more.
